{"editableAreas":[{"identifier":"main","sections":[{"identifier":"c1206b95-83b1-4514-976f-6cbe680962de","type":"CommunityPortal.SingleColumnSection","properties":{"layout":"Standard","layoutParsed":0,"paddingTop":"Large","paddingTopParsed":0,"paddingBottom":"Large","paddingBottomParsed":0,"backgroundColor":"White","backgroundColorParsed":1},"zones":[{"identifier":"36cb7eea-b0a6-402a-a646-34ce7858fca5","widgets":[{"identifier":"a3e5bf72-3c57-4ef6-bfb7-9b96719960cd","type":"CommunityPortal.MarkdownWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"6f9d5a07-6e2f-4698-8197-217a2e05c531","properties":{"markdown":"Interested in Xperience by Kentico but you recently started using macOS? Maybe even one of the super optimized ARM based Apple Silicon processors? No problem! Xperience by Kentico runs great on macOS. Read on to see how to get your environment set up.","markdownStyle":"Standard","markdownStyleParsed":0,"markdownCodeLanguage":"","id":"991f2532-a3ae-4809-9da6-78c15dfe6c67"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"markdown":"222f4e78-cf93-482f-8768-aa506beb1f9f","markdownStyle":"2b12fc75-2da1-4c63-bc9f-04e1777a5533","markdownStyleParsed":"7b50f7bd-4d9a-4b5b-8bc7-4b942bc49ba1","markdownCodeLanguage":"c196850a-1798-4835-b272-c6fe664af81f","id":"e940228e-6b67-4280-81d7-2fd2db80f5e7"}}]},{"identifier":"fdea6566-e744-48e3-a6cd-520a351152ac","type":"CommunityPortal.MarkdownWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"15f1ddfb-244b-48a5-a8d5-690bfa262d99","properties":{"markdown":"This post was written for Xperience by Kentico v29.6.0. Please [consult the documentation](https://docs.kentico.com/x/6wocCQ) for any feature or API changes when using a different version. Be sure to check the [System Requirements](https://docs.kentico.com/x/DgKQC) in the product documentation.","markdownStyle":"Note","markdownStyleParsed":1,"markdownCodeLanguage":"","id":"d6a43e3d-3471-49b6-a1ec-2ed2f4c3cd27"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"markdown":"17909cc9-8935-4d5b-a7c2-8adb7ba6593a","markdownStyle":"f6e3ed56-9299-4076-aac6-2085df0fb6e8","markdownStyleParsed":"b780d11d-694d-4d84-b43d-2d0c88c399cd","markdownCodeLanguage":"97ddf99a-e005-4132-ac06-18261b80c564","id":"6ac6cb72-fd94-4731-9f85-fc4bd2f7dbf7"}}]},{"identifier":"aedacfb7-a211-46dd-a909-7cfc561d359c","type":"CommunityPortal.HeadingWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"ba15b5c2-60ce-433d-96ec-50000ccbb341","properties":{"headingText":"Prerequisites","headingLevel":"H2","headingLevelsParsed":1,"showHeadingAnchor":true,"id":"3394a377-712e-4a7b-a858-8176d78ce60b"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"headingText":"e3deb7dc-4e5c-445b-8849-b754b77eff92","headingLevel":"e8e1a704-63e6-4399-90be-dddbc27ebab1","headingLevelsParsed":"4225fbe2-1df1-4f25-b44c-86d8c59c5f5f","showHeadingAnchor":"135bf23e-81fe-47bd-ac69-c669a3091ab7","id":"a4195f1d-be7e-4d10-a266-70878108285f"}}]},{"identifier":"d1574539-2842-4f0d-b843-e1c3966ddb6b","type":"CommunityPortal.MarkdownWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"b4ca1439-3d48-4929-9749-d4a5f7584f10","properties":{"markdown":"To get started developing with Xperience by Kentico on a modern Mac, we'll need to first install all the toolchain dependencies. We'll start with the list and then we'll cover any details for each one.

- [Visual Studio Code](https://code.visualstudio.com)
- [.NET 8 SDK](https://dotnet.microsoft.com/en-us/download/dotnet/8.0)
- [Docker Desktop](https://www.docker.com/products/docker-desktop/) or [OrbStack](https://orbstack.dev)

For each of these, you'll want to install the arm64 binaries if they are available, as these will perform the best on your M1/M2/M3/M4 [Apple Silicon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apple_silicon) Mac.","markdownStyle":"Standard","markdownStyleParsed":0,"markdownCodeLanguage":"","id":"3f59fe95-deaa-41ea-b80d-ab90a5c1eba5"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"markdown":"ee501460-f8e9-4030-91fb-fdd48e4a5fe3","markdownStyle":"16e5bc94-7911-4437-818d-fb5c3b7a97b8","markdownStyleParsed":"5dd91b19-7a9c-488d-8c4f-4ef6aec046bf","markdownCodeLanguage":"d20d23b8-53fb-4512-9b98-5cb50a002e29","id":"c8b4b748-44c1-4c4b-b018-b04af81a5294"}}]},{"identifier":"818829da-5680-4168-8a34-4692bd37aa04","type":"CommunityPortal.HeadingWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"e215f349-6a2f-47f4-af44-1432331e2f01","properties":{"headingText":"Visual Studio Code","headingLevel":"H2","headingLevelsParsed":1,"showHeadingAnchor":true,"id":"c1682f8b-812e-40f7-b835-6d937ad572fd"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"headingText":"16248e1b-8257-4010-8656-11f4ce0e8e53","headingLevel":"18224a56-9a9e-43aa-99bf-ff78c80d735c","headingLevelsParsed":"e17c548a-7c14-47de-85ed-a857175cc093","showHeadingAnchor":"83b19916-9917-4837-aa27-eb84b393606e","id":"094cff8a-f4d3-4935-a9e4-6e71992a0bf8"}}]},{"identifier":"afb7d1ef-7365-40c5-a826-2ccdc3340c94","type":"CommunityPortal.MarkdownWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"04c3562e-901f-4282-aa7f-cbf0c0451422","properties":{"markdown":"The VS Code installation should be pretty standard, but we'll want to add a few extensions to improve the .NET developer experience.

- [C# DevKit](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=ms-dotnettools.csdevkit)
- [.NET User Secrets](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=adrianwilczynski.user-secrets)
- [MS SQL Server](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=ms-mssql.mssql)

These two extensions will give us language support and the MS SQL Server extension will allow us to connect to our local SQL Server instance and run some queries in VS Code.","markdownStyle":"Standard","markdownStyleParsed":0,"markdownCodeLanguage":"","id":"02020459-5c47-45c8-ac62-c006a63f5feb"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"markdown":"98388dba-1e0f-409a-8bd0-238ff3b63483","markdownStyle":"7c0e5789-07a7-4962-a67c-c0928497e87b","markdownStyleParsed":"e885b0f7-ce7c-45b2-8ed7-283eab8a0ef1","markdownCodeLanguage":"a826d0b2-f9f8-41f0-b83c-d30237078263","id":"ff206296-6fb5-4a6c-8be0-a1b8151b16ce"}}]},{"identifier":"e7eb4695-42af-4a24-a70f-b18c5ad65aee","type":"CommunityPortal.HeadingWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"8313d668-cc38-4da7-886f-35e94da4eb34","properties":{"headingText":".NET you can install the project templates using the following command in your terminal.

kentico.xperience.templates","markdownStyle":"Code","markdownStyleParsed":2,"markdownCodeLanguage":"powershell","id":"b0138162-b745-4615-9255-1b02a0ebf178"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"markdown":"19a9ac72-a147-42b1-8b63-3fc389e073f8","markdownStyle":"b12ba76b-f5fc-4b36-b384-b508d154544b","markdownStyleParsed":"88b08ea6-d917-415c-8f91-bad19f62b6d0","markdownCodeLanguage":"3c17e6ec-d11b-4f37-8da2-8a88a76d26ff","id":"54d5b333-2cf3-4025-af3d-a0bf985f4f10"}}]},{"identifier":"a198368f-7698-486a-bd36-b56ab1c9b096","type":"CommunityPortal.MarkdownWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"055847df-a8e7-4008-9157-61f2b0a81234","properties":{"markdown":"These templates will help us quickly create a new Xperience by Kentico project with just a few commands at the terminal.","markdownStyle":"Standard","markdownStyleParsed":0,"markdownCodeLanguage":"","id":"ac9a0ac2-34f5-4322-a081-e30569244aba"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"markdown":"7c982f45-3779-4c35-8d43-a4f90cd2ac5a","markdownStyle":"ee8a1dd7-d281-405e-9f3e-f8afa61a656a","markdownStyleParsed":"6d5759ee-16df-4e9e-86c2-cf9f211cf20b","markdownCodeLanguage":"c869dca7-db8b-4c99-b156-fa8d7f827ed4","id":"2b57be32-7c72-4668-ae76-73e589fb211d"}}]},{"identifier":"ffbac554-4f2c-4569-b5cd-889d7bbfa79a","type":"CommunityPortal.HeadingWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"cd7c6035-d680-4d85-b1a7-7e3eb8973292","properties":{"headingText":"Docker Desktop","headingLevel":"H2","headingLevelsParsed":1,"showHeadingAnchor":true,"id":"fed339b9-bfac-4dfe-9b79-288ba0925a2d"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"headingText":"39cb46f9-dc99-4fc5-9cb7-f16522107803","headingLevel":"b258b731-5286-4b32-9fee-83e68190200c","headingLevelsParsed":"a288cb0f-08a3-407f-b70e-f553836965a5","showHeadingAnchor":"a567d8f3-dd37-4ce2-8cf4-64d4422e9501","id":"b44f97da-64fd-4e20-af36-aa03f50a3000"}}]},{"identifier":"eb4a5274-92bc-4d75-b647-e26ef7eef7cf","type":"CommunityPortal.MarkdownWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"7f1ec0a5-3abe-4f83-9f43-80d108f98f00","properties":{"markdown":"[Docker Desktop](https://www.docker.com/products/docker-desktop/) (or [OrbStack](https://orbstack.dev/)) will provide a visual application to manage containers and images. It will also come with some smart defaults for setting up your environment for running containers.

Both Docker Desktop and OrbStack require a license for commercial use, but you could try [Colima](https://github.com/abiosoft/colima) or [Podman](https://podman.io/).","markdownStyle":"Standard","markdownStyleParsed":0,"markdownCodeLanguage":"","id":"75fc07c4-52a6-4c60-ad86-3c63d168f787"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"markdown":"43161e92-5ce8-4ca8-a228-56604aa0ffec","markdownStyle":"7bd5202a-4250-4226-92e7-f8a600e0c1a4","markdownStyleParsed":"b76cf93c-a90e-445b-b4e2-d197d85fc37b","markdownCodeLanguage":"d101259f-ed84-4d0b-89ec-99581752d7ef","id":"48c10b99-66c9-4edc-95e2-b79653121851"}}]},{"identifier":"f7d7ce41-7240-48fa-b1bf-bfdd32a0f80d","type":"CommunityPortal.MarkdownWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"6d78bec9-626d-47a7-9ce2-bd615de10445","properties":{"markdown":"Make sure you [Use Rosetta for x86/amd64 emulation on Apple Silicon.](https://community.kentico.com/q-and-a/q/blog-discussion-developing-with-xperience-by-kentico-on-macos#answer_5cda26591d83409ab99c60efb1fe359e) to use the SQL Server container on Apple silicon.","markdownStyle":"Note","markdownStyleParsed":1,"markdownCodeLanguage":"","id":"c1d469ec-b590-459f-ac17-58de3f91863f"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"markdown":"ad7a631e-5863-4efc-8bc7-9fb1a336b240","markdownStyle":"99583cfe-2928-4b33-8d80-f4a227ef6091","markdownStyleParsed":"4bed95a4-9912-48e7-b642-171325f6db61","markdownCodeLanguage":"73eb953c-cd52-4ed0-999f-752aedd96287","id":"d62bf291-a619-466f-8ab9-76ff893bf608"}}]},{"identifier":"75de530d-294e-469c-bce2-504de01b1e7d","type":"CommunityPortal.MarkdownWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"be857582-7c99-4e71-a090-400e95892a80","properties":{"markdown":"Why are we talking about containers? Well, Xperience by Kentico depends on Microsoft SQL Server and the best way to run it on a modern Mac is using the SQL Server 2022 container, which runs on Linux, and Linux is what containers run in, even on MacOS.

We'll run two commands at the terminal. The first will pull the SQL 2022 image (the blueprint for all instances of SQL 2022 that we run) and the second will start a new instance as a container.","markdownStyle":"Standard","markdownStyleParsed":0,"markdownCodeLanguage":"","id":"b99e67e5-af72-4aa7-93cc-6ed5053a7577"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"markdown":"466758e7-802d-425d-a32f-cfe7c86ec6bd","markdownStyle":"516b9b8a-389b-424c-8c39-592bfcb7e0d0","markdownStyleParsed":"ace7563e-8887-40a0-9761-6eea8fdad8d8","markdownCodeLanguage":"1c38e259-15c5-4b52-9009-dcf53e2af1c9","id":"158f2a24-81b9-438e-ac75-0fb792bf640a"}}]},{"identifier":"cdd6990b-ec59-47f8-9d3f-60fc15be5365","type":"CommunityPortal.MarkdownWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"0aa4c136-3f4d-449e-a386-bec8b70884a2","properties":{"markdown":"docker pull mcr.microsoft.com/mssql/server:2022-latest","markdownStyle":"Code","markdownStyleParsed":2,"markdownCodeLanguage":"powershell","id":"915cc09f-1d6b-4c2a-b955-6cc532d31290"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"markdown":"56a65958-997e-4142-b5bb-e3e719597cf5","markdownStyle":"6ae3bd47-8d6c-4210-bb19-d0e327fbad1f","markdownStyleParsed":"14f6f623-dd1a-4fa4-ae1c-d7d54cb54963","markdownCodeLanguage":"5eb7e882-e12a-4fe8-aa9b-946d5d86909d","id":"73fc7e64-9588-47f0-84d6-a07850d0d5e9"}}]},{"identifier":"0cba0ebb-8982-4245-a49a-136a056e40eb","type":"CommunityPortal.MarkdownWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"7929a180-9097-4e05-9157-a8c50d3ebd15","properties":{"markdown":"docker run -e "ACCEPT_EULA=Y" -e "MSSQL_SA_PASSWORD=Pass@12345" \
 -p 1433:1433 --name sql2022 --hostname localhost \
 -d \
 mcr.microsoft.com/mssql/server:2022-latest","markdownStyle":"Code","markdownStyleParsed":2,"markdownCodeLanguage":"powershell","id":"915cc09f-1d6b-4c2a-b955-6cc532d31290"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"markdown":"fecc1304-a46d-4909-8500-906223e2388f","markdownStyle":"f441af92-8384-4ef8-96e2-bfb36a623525","markdownStyleParsed":"c2ef3414-b661-4b14-8716-21350af6de11","markdownCodeLanguage":"5e9cd0d8-f116-4c42-a34a-65943a61ef1c","id":"444d6f7a-90b6-4b45-8695-d6ad7d292e7a"}}]},{"identifier":"e16b4b62-069f-485b-8df7-dacd7bb83124","type":"CommunityPortal.MarkdownWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"5d0938f1-7610-4011-88a8-88e74dd2e57c","properties":{"markdown":"The database server connection details will be the following.

- Server Name: `localhost,1433` (SQL Server uses a comma instead of a colon to separate the host from the port number)
- Username: `sa`
- Password: `Pass@12345` (you can change this if you want)

We can test that our database server is up and running by using VS Code and the MS SQL Server extension to connect to it.

In VS Code, along the right side icon list, you should see an icon for the SQL Server extension. When you click it you will see a new Connections panel appear with a `+ Add Connection` link. Click that and a dialog will appear where you can start entering the connection details above.

You can leave the optional database name value blank. For the login type you want to select `SQL Login`. The credentials are the ones listed above and you can save the password for convenience when prompted.

For a Profile Name you can enter something like `localhost - SQL Server 2022` to help identify it in the future within the SQL Server extension Connections list.

You will be prompted to trust a server certificate, which you will want to accept.

Now you should see your new connection in the panel, which you can expand `localhost - SQL Server 2022` > `Databases` > `System Databases` > `master`. Right click on `master` and select `New Query`.

Enter the following query into the tab that appears.","markdownStyle":"Standard","markdownStyleParsed":0,"markdownCodeLanguage":"","id":"6fa953bf-a679-4eb3-8d05-06a6b2498b0e"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"markdown":"8f280f12-0364-4264-bdb9-36d03786872b","markdownStyle":"74719193-3a1d-4b03-8d97-b84f0de5f8e2","markdownStyleParsed":"0a5314ca-bb07-4e1b-a679-b6dc54e9ac7e","markdownCodeLanguage":"4173c049-5144-40f4-afa0-9ac0d689c8b7","id":"b0cbc7ae-5a23-46f7-ab49-7e6365f82351"}}]},{"identifier":"7fac15b0-8bf1-428d-bb11-43c0963911af","type":"CommunityPortal.MarkdownWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"9043c8e0-fa7b-414b-9c64-00298a4a30d3","properties":{"markdown":"SELECT *
FROM SYS.Databases","markdownStyle":"Code","markdownStyleParsed":2,"markdownCodeLanguage":"sql","id":"1662a5fc-a465-4b51-b2ea-1eb8c1b2dce2"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"markdown":"5c30c77b-3572-4960-bc78-ae6230b4e6a7","markdownStyle":"3556333f-dc4d-4f7e-814f-0d9161ff9927","markdownStyleParsed":"10d141c1-e9d1-48f1-8964-3a470598de2f","markdownCodeLanguage":"c4be4025-315c-4836-9fc5-4cf29f93de7b","id":"534878e2-baea-461b-85a0-baa29b532ffc"}}]},{"identifier":"80ba2e12-b03e-4609-9e0b-6201c318e929","type":"CommunityPortal.MarkdownWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"0d1c256b-b922-4451-b9ff-c9876f5ef4ce","properties":{"markdown":"Now press the green button to the right of the tab name and you should see a new tab with the query results appear. If everything has worked so far, you're all set to setup the Xperience by Kentico project.","markdownStyle":"Standard","markdownStyleParsed":0,"markdownCodeLanguage":"","id":"86f835fd-db1a-48db-97f8-a6df5ce049d4"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"markdown":"25e49037-4041-47a6-95d5-078fe6627f82","markdownStyle":"b9b1f2bc-aecf-4f35-bfd2-908ad836a24d","markdownStyleParsed":"26e04c3a-7c1d-4651-949e-4c791f30bd79","markdownCodeLanguage":"eb6d16f7-b4f7-4b7b-a50f-04d4f4dd71eb","id":"de5e7535-b49f-4a59-ae5c-0b94223bcd50"}}]},{"identifier":"d24ba697-1789-4cbd-a369-fe5b6f2236c7","type":"CommunityPortal.HeadingWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"62e24cd6-1a2b-4c82-8b9b-a8ff036e02cc","properties":{"headingText":"Project Creation","headingLevel":"H2","headingLevelsParsed":1,"showHeadingAnchor":true,"id":"f606d266-2012-4a8d-bc93-9a7b1f2ab9c3"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"headingText":"4f8a1320-55ce-4da8-b0fb-7439589d520d","headingLevel":"78a77e31-cc62-4698-ad82-4f5c2e93bf19","headingLevelsParsed":"77b9571a-a1bb-48f9-ad12-0b9f2160ef1d","showHeadingAnchor":"5872a2c3-4022-48bf-ae9c-a154be3f5eb1","id":"4c23dd51-a5ae-41e6-be17-31d40962541c"}}]},{"identifier":"658ee56f-32f5-4ee8-9826-96f6439de642","type":"CommunityPortal.MarkdownWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"1b1b41c7-fe0f-4217-84c4-c79c10a73e4f","properties":{"markdown":"Return to the terminal and run the following command to create a new Xperience by Kentico ASP.NET Core 8.0 code base.","markdownStyle":"Standard","markdownStyleParsed":0,"markdownCodeLanguage":"","id":"8f3a7b3f-f2bf-4b53-b7c1-6fc1d7f121e6"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"markdown":"e58ada61-086a-4123-bccb-fcaa3cb00291","markdownStyle":"a181a2fe-e9ab-4da7-8d53-66d4a39035ef","markdownStyleParsed":"bfc38e43-353c-4cfb-af94-ea00bf0df02c","markdownCodeLanguage":"27b93b80-dd15-4ee5-8141-6c5573926673","id":"7e9d7730-a913-4541-9dae-edbe544fe153"}}]},{"identifier":"2c389a56-261b-4a56-b584-2d41ec2b93a3","type":"CommunityPortal.MarkdownWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"dea8be73-818e-4f3c-9a38-e7d3486623b0","properties":{"markdown":"dotnet new kentico-xperience-sample-mvc \
 -n DancingGoat.Web \
 -o ./DancingGoat/DancingGoat.Web \
 --allow-scripts Yes","markdownStyle":"Code","markdownStyleParsed":2,"markdownCodeLanguage":"powershell","id":"75300bc6-39b6-44c1-a4b1-8e0d5932f2bd"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"markdown":"bb0988e4-cda1-4ac5-90f0-569bf1e6f4a7","markdownStyle":"c043146b-bfb9-43dd-9313-0618cda6bd48","markdownStyleParsed":"6a7028bc-ff12-4fe9-a8ed-71f7b3f4fbec","markdownCodeLanguage":"25ebc691-4055-4280-bcea-90e1747ac4c5","id":"0a364c38-2dd3-4220-9f87-f8b0fc66c28a"}}]},{"identifier":"d023c2c0-b0e4-4987-9b09-7f97633181cf","type":"CommunityPortal.MarkdownWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"7cbcae23-cd97-4a02-bb44-8524467ffa6d","properties":{"markdown":"This will setup a new code base, creating a `DancingGoat.Web` folder inside of a `DancingGoat` folder in your current directory.

Once this all completes, change directory to `DancingGoat` and open VS Code from that folder.","markdownStyle":"Standard","markdownStyleParsed":0,"markdownCodeLanguage":"","id":"c98fc00a-b12e-444b-8342-9ace8e6ed9cc"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"markdown":"6d5d44f1-6e38-41f0-a494-359cf35d3f71","markdownStyle":"4b002320-be7c-48d3-b958-55ebcdd0728d","markdownStyleParsed":"4e69c653-6598-40c6-9c49-354dc15c9c4f","markdownCodeLanguage":"994662ae-68c5-441a-bba4-95c1419530c7","id":"816b280c-45c1-4027-9554-761ccc5f22a1"}}]},{"identifier":"3137a1cf-6d39-4bd2-ba55-7d4b6429022e","type":"CommunityPortal.MarkdownWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"aa52f261-6638-4b6d-87dc-2b143ef09f4a","properties":{"markdown":"cd DancingGoat
code .","markdownStyle":"Code","markdownStyleParsed":2,"markdownCodeLanguage":"powershell","id":"9a1f322f-b26c-4b95-9f25-22c30ffb8cff"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"markdown":"f45035eb-a258-43df-99f9-b12a6f700a57","markdownStyle":"b537d7ad-6a5c-42e8-bbe7-5279e3f12859","markdownStyleParsed":"6e1e090e-7ddf-4d39-9659-d27a511606be","markdownCodeLanguage":"aa42d148-9936-49f8-8a42-0faeef98c53b","id":"2a7e24ad-cee0-4dfe-b8cd-728ccd5b7181"}}]},{"identifier":"003a0a19-5903-4225-84e4-8a354131ebeb","type":"CommunityPortal.MarkdownWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"9f938c82-3a95-4080-be5d-f506193e352f","properties":{"markdown":"The C# DevKit should detect you are viewing a .NET project and create a `DancingGoat.sln` file in the `DancingGoat` folder.","markdownStyle":"Standard","markdownStyleParsed":0,"markdownCodeLanguage":"","id":"3765a383-f84e-4e83-9760-96b4e3970216"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"markdown":"540f59f1-5067-4347-b717-ef19408cb510","markdownStyle":"2be44d96-d6b4-4302-9f63-19986d20aa30","markdownStyleParsed":"0a29b63e-c24f-4583-a9ab-c1bc34fe4771","markdownCodeLanguage":"a90c6d0a-d6e0-43ec-b1b8-f7c55e5327d8","id":"b059be7d-9f12-45d2-a5e2-1aee5c957bb6"}}]},{"identifier":"321d4fd8-0457-4fac-8180-2c9d102b25e9","type":"CommunityPortal.MarkdownWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"c7792b41-dd39-4c6f-869e-ff7aef0042b7","properties":{"markdown":"You will want to get a license key for Xperience by Kentico which you will put into a text file named `license.txt` in your `DancingGoat.Web` folder. You can follow [the instructions from the documentation](https://docs.kentico.com/x/14bWCQ) to get a license key, which will be used in the next step.","markdownStyle":"Note","markdownStyleParsed":1,"markdownCodeLanguage":"","id":"9ca0d757-53c8-4082-abf1-d0a7b7267f2b"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"markdown":"53fb6d0b-b41e-4987-b337-461d7d8e8c5e","markdownStyle":"2b3c62f1-f3c0-4b75-be14-8b7821b8e360","markdownStyleParsed":"38141633-128e-4c9c-bb93-bdb9105ac79e","markdownCodeLanguage":"4fdbc039-9038-441f-904b-c79271af6f92","id":"8efc459b-1b18-4922-9466-99129e60dae9"}}]},{"identifier":"95079ed8-45e4-4430-a2d0-8472a75e3f18","type":"CommunityPortal.MarkdownWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"9c9bb454-d3fe-4cc0-a249-4b8f98d48c3d","properties":{"markdown":"Go back to your terminal and change directory into the `DancingGoat.Web` folder and then run the Xperience database manager which will create and populate the database for this project.","markdownStyle":"Standard","markdownStyleParsed":0,"markdownCodeLanguage":"","id":"5184a84a-0404-4774-8de3-e7abdf65238e"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"markdown":"3e04d099-fc43-46f9-9404-4fd15ff9780c","markdownStyle":"2bcc50fd-79a7-4883-814f-dde1ae130933","markdownStyleParsed":"44507974-3777-4ff7-beb1-b132d86c79b0","markdownCodeLanguage":"f22eb1f0-50a5-4502-8084-6a1374a3b6a1","id":"547dbedc-a224-471a-b67a-2490bad9d2f1"}}]},{"identifier":"80288ecf-c45a-41eb-a344-3a3ceef9a993","type":"CommunityPortal.MarkdownWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"be4b4a84-a6e8-421a-960d-fb53a2af3684","properties":{"markdown":"cd DancingGoat.Web
dotnet kentico-xperience-dbmanager -- \
 -d DancingGoat \
 -u sa \
 -s "localhost,1433" \
 -p "Pass@12345" \
 -a "Pass@12345" \
 --license-file "license.txt" \
 --recreate-existing-database","markdownStyle":"Code","markdownStyleParsed":2,"markdownCodeLanguage":"powershell","id":"c61d8c36-0f00-4266-bb3b-b3f2657d19e6"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"markdown":"463c9e14-77f1-4685-a149-35d38e1c7d46","markdownStyle":"89c95b34-c89c-44fc-8103-ff861adcd07e","markdownStyleParsed":"90f91b51-3f66-4d13-9477-23f3c9ac9701","markdownCodeLanguage":"9b35b868-77aa-4dc9-8cb8-c58b6b1a495d","id":"06a2d435-01fc-4232-9e69-8f056a1a2686"}}]},{"identifier":"a462dfaf-c942-4dbe-9c23-ee063d71266f","type":"CommunityPortal.MarkdownWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"73509784-d566-422f-bd0a-23cd3e1ac0ca","properties":{"markdown":"The `-p` option is the password for the database and must match the password you provided when creating the container in the previous section.

The `-a` option specifies the password for the `administrator` login to the Xperience by Kentico application.

Once all of this completes we are ready to run the application!

In VS Code, switch to the Explorer tray by clicking the Explorer icon in the left side icon list.
Collapse the `DancingGoat` tray and expand the `Solution Explorer` tray. You should see a solution hierarchy `DancingGoat` > `DancingGoat.Web`.

Right click on `DancingGoat.Web` and select `Debug` > `Start without debugging`.

Some stuff should start displaying in VS Code and when the application starts up, a new browser tab will open to a `localhost` URL and show the Dancing Goat home page.

Update the URL by adding `/admin` to the end of it and you will be taken to the Administration login.

Use the following credentials to login.

- Username: `administrator`
- Password: `Pass@12345` (this is the admin password you specified when using the `kentico-xperience-dbmanager` tool)","markdownStyle":"Standard","markdownStyleParsed":0,"markdownCodeLanguage":"","id":"40babd0b-6189-4758-bbf0-9d731f99bcc3"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"markdown":"9ecbb363-e695-4f6a-9d9f-6af4eefdfe0e","markdownStyle":"0306fb7b-4c31-486b-bc5c-d269e8717ba7","markdownStyleParsed":"0fb2c262-045a-48f1-826b-4326a775ce72","markdownCodeLanguage":"aa1b0671-3d88-4f2d-82c2-6f171237266c","id":"203c569d-b2b2-49a4-933a-17b195a4608e"}}]},{"identifier":"1152721b-a09b-4c93-94bd-463353eb777f","type":"CommunityPortal.HeadingWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"ec39e930-efae-46bd-9207-98be4981d20d","properties":{"headingText":"Wrap Up","headingLevel":"H2","headingLevelsParsed":1,"showHeadingAnchor":true,"id":"47d865bb-e2f8-408e-b1ce-1bfeefa25c88"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"headingText":"a3760011-2fc5-418e-9026-148ed4b23bdc","headingLevel":"27280218-785f-4ef5-9af1-9801c31563d0","headingLevelsParsed":"8d810bca-5e11-4af2-ba3a-41431278861c","showHeadingAnchor":"5b82ae6f-f304-4003-8f39-8a5ab79dcb2c","id":"6d6a3376-60c6-4e38-9825-ad1e6e66c40d"}}]},{"identifier":"3c9adb59-9aeb-4482-9c3c-e99323833e18","type":"CommunityPortal.MarkdownWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"29dad8ac-61df-487a-b27c-bf535e317116","properties":{"markdown":"Now you can check out the [Xperience by Kentico Tutorial](/blog/new-developer-resources-kickstart-your-journey-with-xperience-by-kentico) and [general documentation](https://docs.kentico.com/) to learn more about the product.

You can use [our training guides](https://docs.kentico.com/guides) to learn best practices and see examples of building Xperience by Kentico projects or review the blog post [Learning Xperience by Kentico as a software developer](/blog/learning-xperience-by-kentico-as-a-software-developer).



Check out the [Resource Hub](/resource-hub) here on the Community Portal for more places to continue your Kentico education.

For further reading on using Xperience with macOS, check out Kentico community member Milan Lund's blog post [Setting Up a Solution for Integrating Custom Code in Xperience by Kentico on macOS](https://www.milanlund.com/knowledge-base/setting-up-a-solution-for-integrating-custom-code-in-xperience-by-kentico-on-macos)

Cheers!","markdownStyle":"Standard","markdownStyleParsed":0,"markdownCodeLanguage":"","id":"6f2d84f9-5b77-425f-acd1-0472b81c22dd"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"markdown":"7f594eff-e715-4036-a12b-0ffdf3a4cfab","markdownStyle":"2981c69d-a9a9-4b4c-9be8-5b2e30b4c2df","markdownStyleParsed":"2b17fac1-e10c-4814-a294-e59094fc050c","markdownCodeLanguage":"b6c54819-e317-4f0a-a9a2-08aea7265839","id":"12ca2d47-9846-453a-a318-cd4effdd0f35"}}]}]}],"fieldIdentifiers":{"layout":"ff418874-ea24-451c-a8eb-f2ea8256abb9","layoutParsed":"a931edad-ce63-406c-889c-ab5e14d0e108","paddingTop":"81e8d821-0355-45bd-8c7a-f3670bc09c3f","paddingTopParsed":"90dd7b12-ca6c-4661-99a8-871c675771dd","paddingBottom":"9a11c41b-2e36-46ce-9f60-0ed73bbf0c81","paddingBottomParsed":"16a6f5e9-547d-430f-887f-8ffad7297b9e","backgroundColor":"21684bfb-b56f-4552-b49c-dc1271b772cb","backgroundColorParsed":"2f12bdae-b301-4f6c-ac03-4e119ed0c8cf"}}]}]}
cms.contentitemcommondata.WebPageMetaShortDescription: Learn how to setup an Xperience by Kentico project on macOS and Apple silicon (like an M1 or M2 ARM processor).
cms.contentitemcommondata.WebPageMetaTitle: Developing with Xperience by Kentico on macOS
